xwikidoc.title: Install ROS
xwikidoc.content:
{{toc start="1" depth="6" numbered="false" scope="page"/}}
= Install ROS =
----
1. After installing and conﬁguring Ubuntu as a virtual machine, you can start installing ROS. 1. Start virtual machine and open a new terminal using **[Ctrl]** +** [Alt] **+ **T.** 1. First you have to update the source list or add a new source. The following command is executed in the terminal:(% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ sudo sh -c 'echo "deb http:~/~/packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu $(lsb_release -sc) main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ros-latest.list' ))) 1. In the next step, the key of the foreign source is added to the keybund.(% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ sudo apt-key adv ~-~-keyserver hkp:~/~/ha.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 ~-~-recv-key 421C365BD9FF1F717815A3895523BAEEB01FA116 ))) 1. Before the installation of ROS begins, it is ensured that the system is up-to-date and the new source will be considered. This is done with:(% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ sudo apt-get update ))) 1. ROS includes a variety of packages, tools and libraries, so it is advisable to choose a default installation for the beginning. The following command will download and install an extensive ROS version.((( (% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ sudo apt-get update ))) ))) 1. ((( To be able to use ROS you have to initialize rosdep . This makes it easy to determine system commitments during compilation and is needed for various core components of ROS.
((( (% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ sudo rosdep init ))) )))
(% class="box warningmessage" %) ((( ~> Attention! Do not execute rosdep update with root-privileges! \\ ```bash $ rosdep update ``` ))) ))) 1. ((( The following command adds the ROS environment variables directly to the bash source so that they are directly available in each new bash. To make the change eﬀective, the source of the current Bash is re-selected:
(% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ echo "source /opt/ros/kinetic/setup.bash" >> ~~/.bashrc )))
(% class="box infomessage" %) ((( $ source ~~/.bashrc ))) )))
